name: DEKRA e.V.
bossPosition: Chairman of the Management Board DEKRA e.V. and DEKRA SE
goal:
DEKRA has been active in the field of safety for 90 years. Founded in 1925 in Berlin, it is today one of the world’s leading providers of testing, inspection and certification services.

In 2018, DEKRA generated sales totaling approximately 3.3 billion Euros. The company currently employs more than 46,000 people in more than 50 countries on all five continents. With qualified and independent expert services, they work for safety on the road, at work and at home. These services range from vehicle inspection and expert appraisals to claims services, industrial and building inspections, safety consultancy, testing and certification of products and systems, as well as training courses and temporary work.

The vision for the company’s 100th birthday in 2025 is that DEKRA will be the global partner for a safe world.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives:
DEKRA is actively following every EU policy related to safety (on the road, at work, at home) and sustainability.

Within the context of the Commission’s Road Safety Policy Orientations 2011-2020, DEKRA follows issues such as the roadworthiness package and its implementation in the Member States, the deployment of ITS, the legislations on connected and automated driving including access to data, and the three mobility packages (especially the review of the General Safety Regulation).

DEKRA is actively following the digital policy files, including the Cybersecurity act, the GDPR, the e-privacy Regulation, Artificial Intelligence.

DEKRA is also following the product safety and market surveillance legislations, including medical devices, consumer product safety, personal protective equipments, type-Approval and emission legislations for motor vehicles, lifts, machinery, the goods package and any legislation related to the New Legislative Framework on product safety.

On Energy and environment policies, DEKRA is following the Energy Efficiency Directive, the regulatory framework on labelling and eco-design, the Renewables Energy Directives, and legislations linked to alternative modes of transport.

Free Trade Agreements (including TTIP, CETA, Japan), Nuclear safety, health and safety at work, Qualification of professional drivers (Directive 2003/59), are also closely followed by our EU Representation.
